H0.text: Front is the boundary between two air masses in weather terms.

H1.text: Cloud is the weather term for the boundary between two air masses.

H2.text: Mass is the boundary between two air masses in weather terms.

H3.text: Cover is the boundary between two air masses in weather terms.

A4.text: A stationary front is a non-moving (or stalled) boundary between two air masses, neither of which is strong enough to replace the other.

A5.text: A weather front is a boundary separating air masses for which several characteristics differ, such as air density, wind, temperature, and humidity.
